page.title: 14THE SHEPLEY SPITFIRE
page.content: At the bottom of Mickley Lane a modern public house displays the sign The{Shepley Spitfire.}At first local consultations failed to find a suitable name for this new pub. However,Mr. Shepley of Woodthorpe Hall wrote to the owners to tell them the reason for his proposed name. During the Second World War,one of the Shepley sons lost his life in action. The rest of the family started to raise money to replace this son's Spitfire. The response of the Totley people helped to raise the required amount in a very short time. Now there is this memorial to "One of the few" and the support given to them in Totley.
